data.text:
Last night, #UMES students and staff celebrated the start of the Fall 2024 Semester with a Sophomore Soiree at the Richard A. Henson Center! The Hawaiian luau-themed event made it a fun, relaxed & casual get-together. ğŸŒºğŸŒ´

We took a tour of the #UMES campus to welcome our Hawks home for the 1st day of classes! ğŸ¦…ğŸŒ #HawkPride Worldwide

The New Hawk Welcome Week might be over, yet the memories on the #UMES campus will live on. We are now welcoming all returning students back before the start of the Fall 2024 Semester! #HawkPride Worldwide ğŸ¦…ğŸŒ

A UMES delegation, including President Anderson, attended the Maryland Association of Counties's summer conference in Ocean City last week. At the event, Senators Cardin and Van Hollen announced a $1 million congressional earmark for UMES's proposed School of Veterinary Sciences.

On August 22, we held the Pinning Ceremony for the #UMES Class of 2028 and transfer students! At the ceremony, in the Ella Fitzgerald Performing Arts Center, over 900 first-year students and over 120 transfer students officially became Hawks. ğŸ¦…ğŸŒ #HawkPride Worldwide ğŸ“¸: Zilal Mohamed

Congratulations, #UMES Class of 2028, and transfer students! After your pinning ceremony, you are now officially sworn in as Hawks4Life! #HawkPride Worldwide! ğŸ¦…ğŸŒ ğŸ“¸: Zilal Mohamed

The #UMES Baltimore Alumni Chapter celebrated its annual Crab Feast on Saturday, August 17! ğŸ¦€ Alumni and President Anderson enjoyed good food, drinks, and a party to support student scholarships! ğŸ¦… #HawkPride

At the President's Faculty Appreciation Luncheon, there was a #UMES Gospel Choir performance, and plaques and awards were presented to our faculty to recognize their hard work and dedication! ğŸ¦…ğŸŒ #HawkPride ğŸ“¸: Zilal Mohamed and Earl Holland

#UMES student Oluwatomisin â€œTomiâ€ Salami is a Du Bois Scholar at Harvard University this summer. Tomi, who wants to become a cardiothoracic surgeon, discovered a passion for live cell imaging. The Du Bois Scholars program is a 9-week internship program that brings students from #HBCUs to Harvard to explore mentorship and research opportunities. ğŸ¦… #HawkPride #HarvardUniversity

For the New Hawk Week, students received a big Welcome to the Nest from Vice President Latoya Jenkins, student leaders, and guest speaker Jahvon Gordon! #HawkPride Worldwide! ğŸ¦…ğŸŒ
